introductionContent.text: Levin argues that the meaning of the verb determines to a large extent its syntactic behaviour.
She therefore undertakes the description of English verb classes that share both syntactic alternations and similar meaning.
This claim bears comparison with empirical work in Corpus Linguistics, such as Sinclair's account of yield, where convincing evidence that sense and syntax are closely associated was found.
Similar claims are made in Natural Language Processing, especially in distributional models of meaning) used in a large number of applications).
Levin's verb classes have been integrated and extended into a lexical resource for Natural Language Processing (NLP), VerbNet) used in applications such as Semantic Role Labelling ().
The present paper proposes to create a semantic network from PDEV, by building strings of STs and linking them to verbs.
